The South region may experience more intensive increases in rainfall erosivity in Brazil according to all considered projections. Soil conservation practices must be implemented in croplands, which cover more than 36% of total area of the region
56 . Conservation seeding techniques (e.g. no-tillage), agricultural crops that cover the soil surface and seeding in the dry season must be followed, and the riparian forest must be conserved to mitigate the impacts of the increase in rainfall erosivity on soil and water quality and availability.
